components.description: Japanese sake, an alcoholic beverage made from rice. Shown as a sake set with a carafe (tokkuri) and drinking cup (choko). Most platforms show a cream colored sake set with a blue or red stripe motif. Samsung's design used to show the Japanese script for 'sake' in red along the side of the carafe.
components.title: Sake Bottle and Cup

description: Japanese sake, an alcoholic beverage made from rice. Shown as a sake set with a carafe (tokkuri) and drinking cup (choko). Most platforms show a cream colored sake set with a blue or red stripe motif. Samsung's design used to show the Japanese script for 'sake' in red along the side of the carafe.
title: Sake Bottle and Cup

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Beverage symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An alcoholic beverage popular in Japan, sometimes called rice wine as it is made from rice. Shown¬†as a sake bottle, and a small bowl-like cu http://emojipedia.org/sake-bottle-and-cup/
emoji_net_data.name: sake

bn:00083796v: To consume a liquid containing alcohol.

bn:00087321v: To drink or imbibe with vigour or relish; to drink copiously; to swallow in large draughts.
To consume a liquid through the mouth.
To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.

bn:00080022n: An alcoholic beverage made by fermenting juice of grapes.
Wine is an alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes or other fruits.

bn:00019637n: The ceramic material which makes up potterywares
Pottery is the ceramic act of making pottery wares, of which major types include earthenware, stoneware and porcelain.
Material from which the potteryware is made
Fired ceramic wares that contain clay when formed.
Ceramic ware made from clay and baked in a kiln
Pottery is the ceramic ware made by potters.
Fired ceramic wares that contain clay when formed

bn:00024410n: A concave vessel for holding liquid, generally adorned with either a handle or a stem
A concave vessel for drinking from, usually made of opaque material (as opposed to a glass) and with a handle.
A small open container usually used for drinking; usually has a handle
A cup is a small, open container used for carrying and drinking drinks.

bn:00002519n: An alcoholic beverage is a drink that typically contains 3% -- 40% alcohol.
A liquor or brew containing alcohol as the active agent
That which intoxicates; an intoxicating agent; as, alcohol, opium and laughing gas are intoxicants.
Sometimes referred to as "alcohol", any drink containing ethanol
A fermented drink is a beverage containing alcohol because of a metabolic process that converts sugar to acids, gases and/or alcohol (e.g. beer or wine).
An alcoholic beverage is a drink containing ethanol, commonly known as alcohol -- although in chemistry the definition of alcohol includes many other compounds. beverages
A drink (a liquor or brew) containing ethanol, commonly known as alcohol.

bn:00028916n: Pissed, adj. British and Commonwealth slang, common usage but also mildly vulgar
A temporary state resulting from excessive consumption of alcohol
Drunkenness, also known as inebriation or alcohol intoxication, is a physiological state that occurs when a person has a high level of ethanol in their blood.
Alcohol intoxication is a physiological state induced by the ingestion of ethyl alcohol.

bn:00010183n: Kind of liquid which is specifically prepared for human consumption
Any one of various liquids for drinking.
Drinks, or beverages, are liquids specifically prepared for human consumption.

bn:00067720n: Rice wine; a drink made from filtered fermented rice.
A Japanese alcoholic beverage brewed from rice
Traditional Japanese alcoholic beverage made from rice.
Rice wine, a Japanese alcoholic beverage made from rice.
A sweet low alcohol wine brewed from steamed glutinous rice.
Japanese alcoholic beverage made from fermented rice; usually served hot
Sake or sak√© is an alcoholic beverage of Japanese origin that is made from fermented rice.
Rice wine also known as mijiu, is the eastern alcoholic beverage made from rice, originated from China.

bn:00028749n: A single serving of a beverage

bn:00012339n: A glass or plastic vessel used for storing drinks or other liquids; typically cylindrical without handles and with a narrow neck that can be plugged or capped
A bottle is a rigid container with a neck that is narrower than the body and a "mouth".
A container, typically made of glass and having a tapered neck, used for holding liquids.
A container, typically made of glass or plastic and having a tapered neck, used primarily for holding liquids.

bn:00012195n: An alcoholic beverage that is distilled rather than fermented
A distilled beverage with a high alcohol content, such as brandy, whiskey, or vodka.
A distilled beverage, spirit, liquor, or hard liquor is an alcoholic beverage produced by distillation of a mixture produced from alcoholic fermentation, such as wine.
Alcoholic beverage containing more than 20 percent alcohol.
John Barleycorn is a British folksong.
Alcoholic beverage produced through destillation, regardless of alcohol content.
Alcoholic beverage that is produced by distilling
Strong alcoholic drink derived from fermentation and distillation.
